net.proteusframework.email

Interface EmailConfigType<EC extends EmailConfig>

  • Type Parameters:
    EC - the EmailConfig type.
    All Superinterfaces:
    com.i2rd.implementationmodel.IImplementationModel<EC>, com.i2rd.implementationmodel.Model, net.proteusframework.core.locale.NamedObject
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ContentElementEmailConfigType, ProgrammaticEmailConfigType, UserManagementEmailConfigType

    public interface EmailConfigType<EC extends EmailConfig>
extends com.i2rd.implementationmodel.IImplementationModel<EC>, net.proteusframework.core.locale.NamedObject
    Defines an IImplementationModel for configuring EmailTemplate s for specific uses.
    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@proteus.co)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  EmailConfigType.PreInitContext
      Pre Component.init data that may be useful for creating your UI code.

    • Method Detail

      • createEmailTemplateEditor

        @Nullable net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.composite.editor.ValueEditor<EmailTemplate> createEmailTemplateEditor(EmailTemplate template)
        Create an email template editor.
        Parameters:
        template - the email template.
        Returns:
        the editor or null. If null, a default editor is provided.

      • createEmailTemplateSearchSupplier

        @Nullable net.proteusframework.ui.search.SearchSupplier createEmailTemplateSearchSupplier(EmailConfigType.PreInitContext localeContextSource)
        Optionally create a search supplier for a search UI for finding the EmailTemplates that are specific to this type. The QLBuilder used by the supplier should be rooted at EmailTemplate and return EmailTemplate.
        Parameters:
        localeContextSource - a source to obtain a LocaleContext.
        Returns:
        the search supplier or null.

      • createTestingUI

        @Nullable net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.Component createTestingUI(Supplier<EmailTemplate> emailTemplate)
        Create a testing UI that is specific to this configuration type. This method should only be called if the EmailTemplate is considered to be valid.
        Parameters:
        emailTemplate - the email template supplier.
        Returns:
        the UI or null to use the default UI.
        See Also:
        EmailTemplateTester

      • getDomainModelContext

        com.i2rd.domainmodel.context.DomainModelContext getDomainModelContext(EmailTemplateContext emailTemplateContext,
                                                                      EmailTemplate emailTemplate,
                                                                      EC emailConfig)
                                                               throws EmailTemplateException
        Builds a DomainModelContext to use for an EmailTemplate. The context returned must be configured with the processing context's Locale and TimeZone, and it should have sufficient suppliers and extensions to resolve variables for the system using the template.

        This can be called during display of documentation, during testing, during validation, and while processing an EmailTemplate to generate email data. You can determine what operation is occurring by calling EmailTemplateContext.getMode().

        Parameters:
        emailTemplateContext - the processing context.
        emailTemplate - the email template.
        emailConfig - the email configuration.
        Returns:
        a DomainModelContext, ready to use for generating a message from an EmailTemplate
        Throws:
        EmailTemplateException - if there is an error.

      • instantiateEmailConfig

        EC instantiateEmailConfig()
        Create the EmailConfig used by this type.
        Returns:
        the instance.

      • isValid

        boolean isValid(EmailTemplate emailTemplate,
                net.proteusframework.core.notification.Notifiable notifiable)
        Test if the specified email template is considered value. This should be in addition to the standard validation done for all types of EmailTemplates. If you have no additional validation, return true. This is intended to be called within a request-response.
        Parameters:
        emailTemplate - the email template.
        notifiable - the notifiable to send messages.
        Returns:
        true if valid; otherwise, false.
